Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 2/6/06, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > > > You can use Type Inference.
> > >
> > >
> > > Not when you don't have any types :-)
> >
> > True, but my mind was (silently?) focused on dynamic languages like
> > Smalltalk and Ruby.
>
>
> So is mine, and they're both plagued by this problem.
>
> The only dynamically typed language that doesn't have this limitation is
> Groovy, which lets you specify types for your variables if you really want
> to (and most of the time, I really want to -- at least in method 
> signatures,
> and then I let type inference do its magic).
>
> -

Visual Basic has optional typing also.
